Child as a 
 peacemaker 
 
 John Nga'sike 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A woman carying her baby 
 
 went into the forest to pick 
 
 fruit. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 In the forest she found a 
 
 tre with ripe fruit. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She put down her sleping 
 
 baby and climbed 
 
 the tre. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 An erotot from another 
 
 comunity came 
 
 by and saw the baby. 
 
 Surprised, he asked 
 
 himself, “Where is the 
 
 mother of the baby?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As he bent down, the 
 
 sound of the chains on his 
 
 neck woke the baby. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He let the baby play with 
 
 his chains. The 
 
 baby laughed as he played. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The woman loked down to 
 
 se why the baby was 
 
 laughing. She saw a 
 
 strange man close to her 
 
 baby. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She was so afraid that she 
 
 droped her bag ful of 
 
 fruit. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The erotot loked up and 
 
 said, “Don’t be afraid. I’m 
 
 only playing with your 
 
 beautiful baby.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So the woman came down 
 
 from the tre. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The erotot tok of one of 
 
 his chains. He gave it to 
 
 the baby, and said, “Here is 
 
 a gift for you.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then he said to the 
 
 woman, “Take your baby, 
 
 take your bag, and go 
 
 home.Tel your husband to 
 
 move to a more 
 
 peaceful vilage. Your baby 
 
 has given me peace.”
